body.name: Edge of Time: A Time Travel Adventure Novel
body.description: From the bestselling author of the Noah Hunter series, and Grim Measures, comes a novel that spans centuries as a farmer from the 1700s and an FBI agent travel through time to stop a black hole from destroying the world."Darling has crafted a truly fantastic time-travel novel. Riveting, page-turning, and mind-bending from end to beginning..." - James Downe, author of Sisters of Jade.FBI Special Agent Bradley Holman has been hand-picked to investigate the mother of all cover-ups: a three-hundred-year-old meteorite fragment, sealed away in Fort Knox, was stolen from under the government’s nose. The more he digs, the more he becomes embroiled in a conspiracy kept secret by every president since the formation of the United States.As Holman draws closer to finding the thief, it’s clear he’s out of his depth—both in terms of the powers at play and his understanding of the very fabric of the universe. Thrown into a race to save all life on Earth, Holman must unravel the mysteries of time itself—and not lose his mind in the process. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have a weakness for science fiction, and this story hits all the buttons. It is fast paced and full of unexpected turns and suprises. Well worth the time to read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Unusual Time Travel Adventure
reviews.reviewText: Brad is a government special agent sent to investigate an odd incident at The US Mint in Fort Knox, Kentucky and it opens questions that lead him into an amazing ‘back-in-time’ adventure where he meets Time Traveler, Clement from the 1780’s, and learns about an incredible meteor shower. It all leads to a mystery that will determine Earth’s destiny! I loved the depth of characters, action, science blended with fiction, and amazing possibilities. I couldn’t put this story down and will definitely read a sequel!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book was so exciting and complicated but in a good way. I love time travel books and this is a new take on it. Excellent book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Didn’t guess many of the turns in story
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoyed this novel. Too many books are easy to see what will happen next. Not this one. Try it, you’ll like it! Sure hope there is a sequel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great ride! The story was fantastic and the science seemed acceptable and believable. I would definitely if you want a wild time travel ride.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars starts well. Scatters quickly.
reviews.reviewText: The beginning of of this novel was engaging.However it takes too many detours and loops for my taste.Time travel is a mind-bending concept, and that might explain the scattered plot of this novel, which never came together for me.. It has as many holes as a large block of Swiss cheese. Sorry.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: From the unusual beginning that only made sense near the end, to the most convoluted twists of time all the way to the end, this story was captivating. If there is a sequel, I'll read it. You get to know the characters in all their parralel versions. I am looking forward to more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Time-Travel Tale To Keep You Enthralled Until the Very End
reviews.reviewText: • What starts off as a tale of a simple New England farmer discovering a meteor in his field in 1783 begins turning the reader’s head inside out from the first chapter. The pace is quick and delicious, with a very believable FBI agent taking the role of protagonist. I like time-travel stories, and this one is well done.• I love the premise of this book because it takes time traveling to the level of a national crime. A gold bar worth hundreds of thousands of dollars mysteriously shows up outside the impenetrable Fort Knox, but it’s a gold bar that’s known to have been taken from *INSIDE* the tightly secured facility. The real mystery begins here and keeps you on the edge of your seat until the very end, with the tale taking the reader through a secret kept since the founding of the United States. The protagonist, FBI Special Agent Brad Holman, crisscrosses the nation & time trying to nail down a thief who eludes every trap laid for him. The mystery of how the thief gets in & out so quickly in some seemingly impossible situations is done well, as are the FBI agent’s reactions and countermeasures.• The author ramps up the tension by slowly exposing a much larger, more dangerous world-ending catastrophe with the characters racing to stop it from happening. At times, it can get a bit confusing with multiple persons jumping back & forth in time, but the ending effect is worth it.• Author Darling weaves many places and military knowledge/insights into the story, which helps bring the science fiction to life in very real ways.
Wow! I couldn't put this book down! Lots of plot twists. Incredible information on the unknown forces in the universe. My brain is still spinning. I can't wait for the sequel!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoyed this. As a sci fi fan it was great to read a story with a different take on time travel. Well worth the read.

An amazing book! What really got me hooked was the believability and the work the author obviously did on the research side to understand the mechanics of time travel. I should say the theory of time travel.His characters are easy to understand and empathize with. You can see where they get their motivation. I really enjoyed the characters stuck in what I call the “in between”. If you’re a fan of time, travel, or people who are out of time, this book is one to add to your shelf.It could be possibly better than Michael Creighton’s “timeline”

reviews.reviewTitle: Defies genre – not just for sci-fi fans!
reviews.reviewText: I read and enjoyed all of the author’s Noah Hunter books, but as I’m not a fan of sci-fi hadn’t planned to read Edge of Time. Once I learned the premise of the novel, though, wherein an FBI agent travels through time to save the world, my curiosity was piqued, and now having finished it I have to praise David Darling on his well-paced and exciting storytelling – yet again! Edge of Time perfectly combines crime-solving and sci-fi, much like the television show Fringe used to do, and I enjoyed this novel just as much.

David has scripted an amazing back and forth time travel novel that was hard to put down. From the opening chapter right to the end David paints vivid images in your mind that draws you into the characters and the story line.Can't wait to read his next book.
